name: passff
title: PassFF
author: Johan Venant, Tobias Umbach, et al

preferences.name: callType
preferences.title: Method by which pass is called

preferences.name: shell
preferences.title: Shell used to call pass
preferences.description: Only used for 'Through shell' call method

preferences.name: shellArgs
preferences.title: Arguments for the shell pass is executed in
preferences.description: Only used for 'Through shell' call method

preferences.name: path
preferences.title: PATH for shell environment
preferences.description: Only used for 'Through shell' call method. Leave blank for default

preferences.name: loginFieldNames
preferences.title: Login field name(s)
preferences.description: Name(s) in your password files for the login field. Separate with commas.

preferences.name: passwordFieldNames
preferences.title: Password field name(s)
preferences.description: Name(s) in your password files for the password field. Separate with commas. Will use first line of file if no other matching line is found.

preferences.name: urlFieldNames
preferences.title: URL field names
preferences.description: Name(s) in your password files for URL fields

preferences.name: enterBehavior
preferences.title: Enter behavior
preferences.description: What happens when you press Enter when searching for a password

preferences.name: hotkey
preferences.title: Keyboard shortcut
preferences.description: Key combination to open the password menu. Can be any function key ('f1', 'f2', etc) or one or more modifiers and a key ('<modifier>-<key>'). Modifiers are: 'shift', 'alt', 'meta', 'control', or 'accel' (accel is Ctrl on Linux/Windows, Cmd on OS X). Examples: 'accel-y' or 'control-alt-shift-p'

preferences.name: autoSubmit
preferences.title: Try to submit credentials automatically?
preferences.description: Only used if automatically filling credentials

preferences.name: iframeSearchDepth
preferences.title: Iframe search depth
preferences.description: How many layers of iframes should we search when trying to auto-fill or auto-submit login credentials?
